\numi{5} (\AmA) 
\banum

\alnum{b} gAbarigoLisu; hedarike huTiTxsu; digilubiVLisu: \eng{the spectral appearance rattled the lone traveller} A BUtAkAravu oMTiyAda parxyANikananunx gAbarigoLisitu.

\numie

\bentry
\word[read(1)]{read}
\pron{riVDf}
\gl{\kirx}
\expl{(\BU\ matutx \BUkaq\ \eng{read}\ \ucAcx\ reDf). }


\noindent
\gl{\sakirx}
\bmng
\bnum
\numi{1} Odu: 
\banum
\alnum{a} (keYbaraha yA acAcxda barehavanunx) Odi arituko, athaRmADiko: \eng{read a book} pusatxkavanunx Odu, Odi athaRmADiko. 
\alnum{b} \eng{read the book silently} pusatxkavanunx mwnavAgi (manasisxnalelxV) Odiko; (athaRvAguvaMte manasisxnalelxV) Odiko. 
\alnum{c} (gaTiTxyAgi) Odu; paThisu; vAcisu: \eng{he read the story to his children} Ata katheyanunx makakxLigAgi, makakxLedurinalilx Odida. \eng{read aloud} gaTiTxyAgi Odu. 
\alnum{d} BASeya sAkaSuTx tiLivaLikeyiMda, paricayadiMda (A BASeya garxMtha \mo vanunx) Odi athaRmADiko: \eng{he is able to read French} avanu pherxMcanunx, pherxMcinalilxruva pusatxka \mo vanunx Odabalalx. 
\alnum{e} (noVTadiMdalalxde, beraLugaLiMda muTiTx) Odu: \eng{read Braile} berxVlf lipiyanunx (beraLiniMda) Odu. 
\alnum{f} (citarxlipi, SATfR hAyxMDf yA beVre saMkeVtagaLalilxruva barehavanunx ADuva BASege mApaRDisi) OdiheVLu: \eng{he can read hieroglyphics} Ata citarxlipiyanunx Odabalalx. 
\alnum{g} (viVkaSxNa yA pariVkaSxNadiMda vidayxmAnada) athaRvanunx tiLi; pariNAmavanunx, sUcaneyanunx garxhisu, ari: \eng{he read the dark, cloudy sky as the harbinger of a storm} kAmuRgilu kavida AkAshavanunx noVDi avanu caMDamAruta birumaLegaLa munfsUcaneyanunx aritukoMDa. \eng{read the sky} AkAshakAyagaLanunx viVkiSxsi KagoVLavanunx arituko. 
\alnum{h} (keY \mo vanunx noVDi) BaviSayx heVLu: \eng{read a person's hand} vayxkitxya keY noVDi BaviSayxheVLu. \eng{read a dream} savxpanxda mamaRvanunx heVLu; savxpanxvu sUcisuva Palavanunx heVLu. 
\alnum{i} Odi atheYRsu; athaR -- heVLu, biDisu: \eng{read the riddle} ogaTanunx (Odi) biDisu. \eng{read an omen} shakuna heVLu. \eng{read futurity} BaviSayx heVLu. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{2} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (vayxkitxya cahare \mo vugaLiMda) avana aMtaraMgavanunx heVLu; mamaRvanunx BeVdisu, ari: \eng{read men's thoughts} vayxkitxgaLanunx noVDi avara manasisxnalilxna vicAragaLanunx ari. \eng{read men's face} vayxkitxgaLa muKa noVDi avara manasasxnunx ari. 
\alnum{b} vayxkitxya mAtugaLanunx keVLi yA avana saMjecnxgaLanunx noVDi arituko yA atheYRsu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{3} athaYRsu; (heVLike, vataRne, \mo vugaLalilx vayxkatxvAgi kANada) Ashayavanunx, udedxVshavanunx, sUcita athaRvanunx -- Uhisu, kalipxsu: \eng{you read too much into the text} niVnu A garxMthaBAgakekx atiyAda, iruvudakikxMta hecAcxda athaR kalipxsutitxdidxVye. \eng{my silence is not to be read as consent} nananx mwnavanunx opipxgeyeMdu atheYRsabAradu. 
\num{4} (garxMthada yA saMpAdakana \vi) (kataqRvina pAThaveMdu Uhisi) pAThavanunx, pAThAMtaravanunx koDu: \eng{Bently reads `peraeque'} beMTilxyu \eng{peraeque} eMba pAThavanunx koTiTxdAdxne. 
\numi{5} (mudarxNa) 
\banum
\alnum{a} karaDanunx pariVkiSxsu, sarinoVDu, saritapupxgaLanunx gamanisu. 
\alnum{b} (tapupx bareha yA acacxnunx tidudxvalilx) tidudxpaDiyanunx koDu: \eng{for `one thousand', read `ten thousand' `one thousand'} ge badalu \eng{`ten thousand'} eMdu OdikoLiLx. \eng{for white read black, and the account may be accepted} (hAsayxda mAtu) kapapxnenxV biLupeMdu tiLidukoMDare, I lekakxvanunx aMgiVkarisabahudu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{6} (aLate, parxmANa toVrisuva mApakagaLa \vi) aMkavanunx, parxmANavanunx -- sUcisu, toVrisu: \eng{the thermometer reads $30^\circ$} uSaNxmApakavu \eng{$30^\circ$} yanunx sUcisutatxde. 
\num{7} (\kanmu\ \birx) Odu; kali; vAyxsaMga mADu; adhayxyana mADu: \eng{he is reading law} avanu nAyxyashAsatxrXvanunx kaliyutitxdAdxne, vAyxsaMga mADutitxdAdxne. 
\num{8} Odi Odi oMdu sithxtiyanunx taMduko; oMdu sithxtige baruvavaregU Odu: \eng{read oneself to sleep} Odi Odi nidedx taMdukoMDa. \eng{read himself stupid} Odi Odi pedadxMBaTaTxnAda. 
\num{9} (obabxnige) budidhx heVLu, kalisu; pATha heVLu; upadeVsha mADu: \eng{read one a lesson, lecture} obabxnige budidhxkalisu, upadeVsha mADu. 
\num{10} (pAliRmeMTf \mo vugaLalilx masUdeyanunx) maMDisu; paThisu; vAcisu: \eng{the bill was read for the first time} masUdeyu modala sala maMDisalapxTiTxtu, paThisalapxTiTxtu; masUdeya parxthama paThana, vAcana Ayitu. 
\num{11} (tuMba) Odi vidAvxMsanAgiru: \eng{he has read much} Ata tuMba OdidAdxne; Ata tuMba Odidavanu, kalitavanu, vidAvxMsa. 
\num{12} (garxMtha \mo vugaLalilx heVLiruvudanunx) Odiru; kaMDiru: \eng{revenge, we read, is wild justice} parxtiVkAravu anAgarikavAda nAyxya eMdu OdidedxVve. \eng{I have read of it somewhere} adanenxlolxV OdidedxVne. 
\numi{13} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (kaMpUyxTarina \vi) (datAtxMshavanunx) kApi mADu yA vagARyisu. 
\alnum{b} (\eng{read in, out}) (datAtxMshavanunx) ilekATxrXnikf sheVKaraNa sAdhanadalilx dAKalumADu yA tege. 
\eanum
\numie
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\akirx}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} OdidAga oMdu nidiRSaTx riVtiyalilx athaR koDu, niVDu: \eng{it reads persuasively} adu manavopipxsuvaMte athaRkoDutatxde. 
\num{2} OdidAga keVLuvavanige yA Oduganige nidiRSaTx riVtiyalilx keVLisu, kANisu yA pariNAma biVru: \eng{the book reads like a parody} pusatxka viDaMbanAtamxka kaqtiyaMte kANisutatxde. 
\num{3} oMdu koVsaRnunx, vAYxsaMgavanunx mADutitxru: \eng{is reading for the Bar} avanu vakiVli vaqtitxgAgi, vakiVli vaqtitx hiDiyalu OdutitxdAdxne. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{a reading man} OdALi; vAYxsaMgashiVla. 
\num{2} \eng{a read speech} (baredu) Odida BASaNa. 
\num{3} \eng{deeply read} ALavAgi Odida; gahanavAda pAMDitayxvuLaLx; pAraMgata; kUlaMkaSa jAcnxnavuLaLx. 
\num{4} \eng{extremely read} tuMbA, apAra -- Odida: \eng{an Oxford man extremely read in Greek} girxVkfnalilx apAra pAMDitayx gaLisiruva AkfsxphaDfR vidAvxMsa. 
\num{5} \eng{it reads like a translation} Odidare adoMdu BASAMtara enisutatxde. 
\num{6} \eng{little read} EnU Odilalxda, kalitilalxda; apaMDita; avidAvxMsa. 
\num{7} \eng{read off} (liKita viSayavanunx yA liKita viSayada ulelxVKa, ulelxVKagaLanunx) gaTiTxyAgi Odu. 
\num{8} \eng{read-oneself in} (pAdirxya \vi) AYxMgilxkanf caciRna \eng{39} kalamugaLanunx Odi adhikAra vahisiko. 
\num{9} \eng{read between the lines} (dAKale patarx, BASaNa \mo vugaLalilx) rahasAyxthaRvanunx, aDagiruva athaRvanunx, kUTAthaRvanunx -- huDuku yA kaMDuhiDi. 
\num{10} \eng{read (person)a lecture} (\engit{or} \eng{a lesson)} vayxkitxyanunx KaMDisu, vayxkitxge CiVmAri hAku. 
\num{11} \eng{read a person like a book} vayxkitxya -- oLa mamaRvanunx, aMtaraMgavanunx, udedxVsha \mo vanunx ari, athaRmADiko. 
\num{12} \eng{take it} (\engit{or} \eng{something) as read} adanunx vicAra mADabeVkAgilalxveMdu, caceRmADade opapxbahudeMdu -- garxhisu, BAvisu. 
\num{13} \eng{read on} OdutAtx hoVgu; vAcana, paThana muMduvaresu. 
\num{14} \eng{read up(on) something} (oMdara bagegx) visAtxravAgi vAyxsaMga mADu, vAyxpakavAgi Odu yA visheVSAdhayxyana naDesu. 
\numi{15} \eng{read out} 
\banum
\alnum{a} gaTiTxyAgi Odu. 
\alnum{b} (\ame) rAjakiVya pakaSx \mo vugaLiMda (vajApatarxvanunx Odi) bahiSakxrisu, horadUDu. 
\eanum
\numie

\alnum{a} vayxvAhAra jAcnxna; viveVkayuta vataRne; nAyxyaniVti. 
\alnum{b} loVka mayARde; loVkarUDhi; vihitavAda, atireVkakekx hoVgada, elelxmiVrada vataRne: \eng{I will do anything in reason} loVkamayARdege oLapaTaTx yAvudanenxV Agali mADalu nAnu sidadhx. 
\alnum{c} nAyxyasamamxtavAdadudx; yukatxvAdadudx. 
\alnum{d} nAyxya; nAyxyasamamxtavAda, yukatxvAda mAtu: \eng{hear reason} nAyxyavanunx keVLu. \eng{listen to reason} yukatxvAda mAtige kivigoDu. 
\alnum{e} yukAtxyukatx parijAcnxna; nAyxyayukatxte; aucitayx: \eng{there is reason in what he says} avanu heVLuvudaralilx aucitayxvide. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{7} udedxVsha; kAraNa; samathaRne: \eng{has good reasons for doing this} idanunx mADalu oLeLxya kAraNagaLanunx hoMdidAdxne. \eng{no reason to be angry} siTATxgalu kAraNavilalx. 
\num{8} sahajajAcnxna; aMtaboRVdhe; budidhx, garxhaNashakitxyanunx miVrida nigamana takaRsUtarxgaLanunx odagisuva sahajajAcnxnashakitx.

\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{as reason was} viveVcanege toVridaMte; viveVcaneyu perxVreVpisidaMte. 
\num{2} \eng{bring to reason} nAyxyada dArige yA viveVkada mAgaRkekx taru. 
\num{3} \eng{by reason of} A kAraNadiMda: \eng{the institution failed by reason of its bad organisation} A saMsethxyu adara aBadarxvAda saMGaTaneyiMda viPalagoMDitu. 
\num{4} \eng{have reason} (ninage) yukAtxyukatx parijAcnxna irali; aucitayxjAcnxna irali. 
\num{5} \eng{in} (\engit{or} \eng{within) reason} viveVcaneya yA mitiya elelxyoLage. 
\num{6} \eng{listen to reason} viveVkadiMda vatiRsuvaMte Agu; nAyxyakekx kivigoDu. 
\hyperdef{R}{reason(1) pagu(7)}{} 
\numi{7} \eng{see reason} 
\banum
\alnum{a} vAdada yukatxteyanunx ari. 
\alnum{b} budidhxbaru; viveVka taMduko, gaLisiko, paDeduko; viveVkadiMda vatiRsu. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{8} \eng{stand to reason} 
\banum

\alnum{b} takaRsamamxtavenisu: \eng{what he says stands to reason} avanu heVLuvudu takaRsamamxtavenisutatxde. 
\eanum
\numie

\num{10} \eng{without rhyme or reason} nAyxya -- niVti yAvudU ilalxde. 
\num{11} \eng{woman's reason} sitxrXVtakaR; heMgasina vAda saraNi, riVti; oMdu heVLikege A heVLikeyanenxV kAraNavanAnxgi yA vivaraNeyanAnxgi punarucacxrisuvudu; punarukitx takaR, \udA\ \eng{I love him because I love him} avananunx pirxVtisuvudariMda nAnavananunx pirxVtisutetxVne.

\num{3} (\rUpa) (peTuTx, noVvu, manasisxguMTAda AGAta, \mo vanunx) tALiko; taDeduko; sahisiko: \eng{he received the shock with equanimity} A AGAtavanunx avanu samacitatxdiMda tALikoMDa.

\num{5} oLakekx baragoDu; oLage eDegoDu, avakAsha koDu, AsapxdakoDu: \eng{I had to receive his visits} avana BeVTigaLige nAnu eDegoDabeVkAyitu. 
\num{6} sivxVkArakekx -- IDAgu, pAtarxvAgu, BAjanavAgu: \eng{the basin received Chirst's blood} A boVguNiyu kirxsatxna rakatxkekx BAjanavAyitu. \eng{he was fitted to receive the knowledge of God} deVvaranunx kurita jAcnxnakekx avanu pAtarxvAgidadx.

\num{10} (soVlanunx) opipxko: \eng{the town received the French contingent} A paTaTxNavu pherxMcf paDege soVlanonxpipxtu. 
\num{11} baramADiko; baragoDu: \eng{he shall not be received at my house} avananunx nananx manege baragoDuvudilalx. 
\num{12} atithiyAgi yA aBAyxgatananAnxgi satakxrisu, Adarisu: \eng{he that receiveth me receiveth Him that sent me} nananxnunx aBAyxgatananAnxgi yAvanu AdarisutAtxnoV avanu nananxnunx kaLuhisidavananenxV (BagavaMtananenxV) AdarisidaMte.

\num{3} (tapipxhoVgidadx dAriyanunx) punaH kaMDuko patetxhacucx: \eng{he recovered the track} (tapipxhoVgidadx) dAriyanunx punaH kaMDukoMDa. 
\numi{4} (AroVgayx, sAvxsathxyX, parxjecnx, hasivu, \mo vanunx) 
\banum

\alnum{b} paDeyuvaMte mADu: \eng{a dash of cold water recovered her} savxlapx taNiNxVreracidadxriMda avaLu parxjecnx paDedukoMDaLu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{5} (kugigxhoVgidadx dhavxniyanunx) punaH paDeduko: \eng{he recovered his voice} (kugigxhoVgidadx) dhavxniyanunx avanu punaH paDedukoMDa. 
\num{6} (vasha tapipxhoVgidudxdanunx) punaH vasha paDisiko: \eng{they recovered much land from the sea} (samudarxda pAlAgidadx) tuMba BUmiyanunx avaru punaH vashakekx taMdukoMDaru. 
\num{7} (mokadadxme naDesi koVTiRna mUlaka) Asitxya supadaRnunx yA naSaTxda, anAyxyada parihAravanunx paDeduko: \eng{plaintiff shall recover according to verdict} tiVpiRna parxkAra vAdiyu supadaRnunx paDeyatakakxdudx. \eng{an action to recover damages for false imprisonment} suLuLx ApAdane horisi seremanege kaLuhisida anAyxyakAkxgi parihAra paDedukoLaLxlu hUDida mokadadxme. 
\num{8} (\AtAmx) (pArxNa, parxjecnx, sAvxsathxyX, aMgagaLa meVle hatoVTi, \mo vanunx) paDeduko; ceVtarisiko. 
\num{9} (kaLeduhoVgidudxdanunx) punaH paDeduko; (naSaTxvanunx) tuMbiko, pariharisiko: \eng{recovered his losses} tananx naSaTxgaLanunx avanu tuMbikoMDa.

\num{11} (\viparx) matetx (savxsAthxnakekx yA hiMdina sAthxnakekx) hiMdirugu: \eng{he recovered the shore with difficulty} parxyAsadiMda avanu matetx tiVrakekx hiMdirugida.

\num{3} (manasA yA kAyaRtaH) beVroMdu rUpakekx taru, iLisu; rUpAMtaragoLisu: \eng{reduce rule to practice} niyamavanunx jArige taru, AcaraNege taru. \eng{reduce anomalies to the rule} vayxtikarxmagaLanunx EkasUtarxkikxLisu. \eng{reduce dissimilar quantities to one denomination} beVrebeVre jAtiya saMKeyxgaLanunx yA rAshigaLanunx EkajAtige, EkarUpakekx taru. \eng{reduce one's thoughts to writing} tananx manasisxna aloVcanegaLanunx barehakikxLisu. 
\num{4} (yAvudakekxV hoMduvaMte) hadakekx taru; hadagoLisu; hasanugoLisu: \eng{reduce surface by harrowing} kuMTe hoDedu nelavanunx hadagoLisu. 
\num{5} vagiRVkaraNadiMda yA vishelxVSaNadiMda beVkAda rUpakekx iLisu: \eng{the facts may all be reduced to three heads} I viSayagaLanenxlalx mUru vagaRgaLAgi vishelxVSisabahudu yA mUru guMpugaLAgi viMgaDisabahudu.

\num{8} (balaparxyoVgadiMda, yA anivAyaR parisithxtiyanunx kalipxsi, vayxkitxyanunx) oMdu sithxtige taru, iLisu; aDagisu; heVLidadxnunx mADuva sithxtige taru; parAdhiVna sithxtige taru: \eng{reduce the Crown to submission to the Parliament} rAjananunx pAliRmeMTige maNiyuva sithxtige taru. \eng{reduce to despair} nirAsheya sithxtige taru.

\bnum
\num{1} (yAvudeV viSayakekx, vayxkitx \mo varanunx) mUla yA kAraNa eMdu AroVpisu; heVLu: \eng{refer one's victories to Providence} tananx vijayagaLigelalx deYvakaqpeyeV kAraNa eMdu heVLu.

\num{3} (vayxkitxyanunx yA tananxnenxV, yA payARloVcanegAgi oMdu viSayavanunx, vayxkitxge yA saMsethxge) opipxsu; vahisikoDu; biTuTxkoDu: \eng{let us refer the dispute to the Director} I vAyxjayxvanunx payARloVcanegAgi nideRVshakarigeV opipxsibiDoVNa. \eng{I refer myself to your generosity} nAnu nananxnunx tamamx audAyaRkekx biTuTxkoMDidedxVne. 
\num{4} (agatayxvAda satAyxMshavanunx kaMDuhiDiyuvudakAkxgi adanunx balalx adhikAriyanunx, adu doreyuva parxmANa garxMtha yA beVre Akaravanunx) Asharxyisu; keVLu yA avaloVkisu.

\num{6} (keVLutitxruvavana \vi) oMdu viSayakekx anavxyisu, saMbaMdhagoLisu: \eng{these remarks refer only to deliberate offences} I TiVkegaLu budidhxpurasasxravAgi mADida aparAdhagaLige mAtarx anavxyisutatxve. \eng{these remarks are not to be referred to involuntary offences} I TiVkegaLanunx tiLiyade mADida aparAdhagaLige anavxyisalAgadu. 
\hypertarget{refer sakirx(7)}{} 
\num{7} (mAtanADutitxruvavana \vi) parxsAtxpisu; sUcisu; nideRVshisu; gamanaseLe: \eng{he referred to the increase in expenditure} KacuR hecicxruvudanunx avanu parxsAtxpisida. \eng{he was on the peak referred to} Ata hiMde sUcisida shiKarada meVlidadx.

\noindent
\gl{\akirx}
\bmng
\bnum

\banum
\alnum{a} neravu, sahAya--koVru.

\numie

\num{8} (kAvayx \mo vugaLalilx BAva \mo vanunx) aBivayxkatxgoLisu; nirUpisu; parxkAshapaDisu: \eng{poetry cannot be rendered adequately in another language} kAvayxvanunx anayxBASeyalilx samapaRkavAgi aBivayxkatxgoLisalAguvudilalx; kAvayxvanunx anayxBASege samapaRkavAgi tajuRme mADalAguvudilalx.

\num{7} (shAsanasaBe) (samitiya adhayxkaSxna \vi) samitiyu (masUdeyanunx) parishiVlisideyeMdu GoVSisu. 
\num{8} (viSayavanunx) padashaH yA saMgarxhavAgi yA parxkaTanegAgi--vaNiRsu, nirUpisu, varadi mADu (\akirx\ saha): \eng{report a law case} mokadadxmeya vicAraNeyanunx varadi mADu. \eng{report the proceedings of the committee} samitiya kAyaRkalApagaLa varadi opipxsu. \eng{he reports to the Hindu} avanu hiMdUpatirxkege varadi mADutAtxne.

\num{6} \eng{report back} tAnu yAva vayxkitx yA saMsethxya paravAgi kelasa mADutitxruvanoV A vayxkitx yA saMsethxge varadi kaLisu.

\num{2} (sUyaR, caMdarx yA tAregaLa \vi) huTuTx; udayavAgu; digaMtadiMda meVle baru, kANisiko. 
\num{3} (malagidadx, kuLitidadx, moNakAlUridadx sithxtiyiMda) ELu; meVlakekxVLu; edudxnilulx: \eng{all rose to receive him} avananunx sAvxgatisalu elalxrU edudxniMtaru. 
\num{4} hAsige biTeTxVLu; nidedxyiMdeVLu: \eng{rise with the lark} bAnADiya jotegeV nidedxyiMdeVLu; beLagina jAvakekxV ELu. 
\num{5} (saBe \mo vu) konegoLuLx; mukAtxyavAgu: \eng{parliament will rise next week} pAliRmeMTina adhiveVshana muMdina vAra mukAtxyavAgutatxde. 
\num{6} (bAgidudx) neTaTxgAgu; neTaTxgenilulx: \eng{he was too weak to rise} ati nishayxkitxyiMda avanige neTaTxge nilalxlU Agutitxralilalx. \eng{the hair rose on his head} avana talegUdalu nimiri niMtitu. 
\num{7} neladiMda ELu: \eng{fell never to rise again} matetx nela biTuTx ELalArada hAge bidadxnu. 
\num{8} (satitxdudx) matetx edudx baru; pArxNa matetx paDe; punaH jiVvisu: \eng{rise from the dead} matetx jiVvapaDe; satitxdadxvanu jiVva paDedu meVlakekx ELu. 
\num{9} ELu; biVsatoDagu: \eng{if a wind should rise} gALi EnAdarU edadx pakaSxdalilx. 
\num{10} daMgeyeVLu; parxtiBaTisu; kArxMtiELu: \eng{town rose in revolt against the oppressor} Uru dabAbxLikegArana virudadhx daMgeyedidxtu. 
\num{11} ELu, meVlakekx hoVgu, baru, beLe, hatutx: \eng{tree rises 20 ft.} maravu \eng{20} aDi etatxra beLeyutatxde. 
\num{12} (tiVvarxte, bala, gAtarx, sAMdarxte, maTaTx, \mo vu) hecAcxgu; Eru: \eng{her colour rose} Akeya muKa keMpeVritu, kaLeyeVritu. 
\num{13} (yiVsfTxniMdAgi hiTuTx) ububx: \eng{bread will not rise} roTiTx ububxvudilalx. 
\num{14} (motatx, maTaTx) Eru; vadhiRsu; vaqdidhxyAgu; hecAcxgu: \eng{the mercury is rising} pAdarasada maTaTx Erutitxde. 
\num{15} (dhavxniya \vi) hecAcxgu; Eru; joVrAgu: \eng{their voices rose with excitement} saMBarxmadiMda avara gaMTalu joVrAdavu. 
\num{16} etatxravAgu; meVlamxTaTxdalilxru: \eng{should rise above petty jealousies} saNaNx puTaTx asUyegaLige IDAgade meVlamxTaTxdalilxrabeVku. 
\num{17} unanxta sAmAjika sAthxnakekx yA oLeLxya sithxtige baru; aBivaqdidhxge baru: \eng{rose from the ranks} keLasatxradiMda meVlakekxVrida. 
\num{18} Eru; meVlakekx Olu: \eng{rising cupboard} aDige maneyalilx Eruva baDu. 
\num{19} meVle kANisiko; kANabaru; meVlakekx baru; darxvada meVlamxY meVle baru: \eng{bubbles rose from the bottom} taLadiMda guLeLxgaLu meVlemxYmeVle baMdavu. \eng{waited for the fish to rise} miVnu niVrina meVlakekx baralu kAdanu. \eng{fish rises} AhArakAkxgi miVnu (niVrina) meVlakekx barutatxde. 
\num{20} udayisu; mUDu: \eng{picture rises before the mind} manasisxnalilx citarx mUDutatxde. 
\num{21} vadhiRsu; hecAcxgu; balavAgu; joVrAgu: \eng{spirits rise} utAsxha joVrAgutatxde. \eng{ten interest rises with each act} aMka aMkakUkx Asakitx, kutUhala hecucxtatx hoVgutatxde. 
\num{22} parxvadhaRmAnakekx baru; parxgati hoMdu; aBivaqdidhx hoMdu; muMdebaru; meVlakekx baru; parxgatishiVlavAgiru: \eng{the rising generation}, parxgatishiVla taruNa piVLige. 
\num{23} sutatx mutatxla parxdeVshakikxMta meVle edudxkANu: \eng{mountains rose to our right} pavaRtagaLu namamx balagaDe edudx kANutitxdadxvu.

\num{11} (pusatxkada raTuTxkaTuTxvike) raTuTxkaTiTxna uruLe; raTiTxna meVle uruLisi (ububxreVKegaLu, giliVTu \mo vanunx) gurutumADalu upayoVgisuva, gAliyAkArada salakaraNe.

\num{14} uruLATa; horaLATa; uruLu(vudu); horaLu(vudu); tUgATa: \eng{the roll of the ship} haDagina tUgATa.

\bentry

\pron{roVlf}
\gl{\sakirx}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} uruLisu; horaLisu: \eng{roll the barrel} piVpAyiyanunx uruLisu. 
\num{2} tirugisu; horaLisu; sutitxsu: \eng{rolling a marble between his palms} avana aMgeYgaLa madheyx goVliyanunx horaLisutAtx. 
\num{3} (suruLi) sututx; sutitxkoV; hodeduko: \eng{rolled himself up in the blankets} kaMbaLigaLalilx tananxnunx sutitxkoMDanu. 
\num{4} horaLisu: \eng{rolled his eyes on us} namamx kaDe avana kaNuNxgaLanunx horaLisidanu. 
\num{5} (niVrinalilx, kesarinalilx, maraLinalilx) uruLADu; horaLADu; OlADu; muLugi teVlu: \eng{porpoise rolls in the water} kaDalahaMdi niVrinalilx uruLADutatxde. 
\num{6} ale aleyAgi hoVguvaMte, hariyuvaMte, uruLuvaMte -- mADu, oyiyx: \eng{river rolls its waters to sea} nadi tananx niVranunx samudarxkekx harisikoMDu oyuyxtatxde. 
\num{7} (shabadx) moLagisu; anuraNana mADu; tuMbudaniyalilx ucacxrisu; taraMga taraMgavAgi baruvaMte mADu; GoVSadiMda heVLu: \eng{roll out verses} padayxgaLanunx GoVSadiMda heVLu. 
\num{8} otutx; laTiTxsu; uruLeyiMda otitx (yA otutx uruLegaLa madheyx hAyisi) capapxTe, sapATu, maTaTxsa -- mADu: \eng{roll paste for pies} kaDubigAgi kaNakavanunx laTiTxsu. 
\num{9} suruLisututx; suruLi mADu: \eng{the way to roll a greatcoat} meVlaMgiyanunx suruLi mADuva vidhAna. \eng{rolled a newspaper} vaqtatxpatirxkeyoMdanunx suruLisutitxdanu. 
\num{10} uMDe sututx; uMDemADu; suruLimADu: \eng{roll snow into ball} himavanunx ceMDinaMte uMDe mADu. 
\num{11} (muduriruvudanunx, suruLi sutitxruvudanunx) capapxTeyAgi hAsu; samanAgi haraDu: \eng{he rolles the map out on the table} BUpaTavanunx meVjina meVle capapxTeyAgi haraDidanu. 
\num{12} sututx; sutitxDu; mucucx; hodidxsu: \eng{she rolled the child in a blanket} maguvanunx kaMbaLiyalilx sutitxdaLu. 
\num{13} (madadxleyanunx) balavAgi matutx veVgavAgi bArisu.

\emng

\noindent
\gl{\akirx}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} uruLu; horaLu: \eng{ball rolled under the table} ceMDu meVjina keLage uruLihoVyitu. 
\num{2} (kaNuNx) horaLu: \eng{his eyes roll strangely} avana kaNuNXgaLu vicitarxvAgi horaLutatxve. 
\num{3} OlADu; tUgu; tUgADu; hoyAdxDu; OlADutAtx naDe: \eng{ship rolls and pitches} haDagu ELutAtx biVLutAtx tUgADutatxde. 
\num{4} alealeyAgi, taraMgataraMgavAgi -- hoVgu, hari, uruLu; alealeyAda calaneyanunx yA meVlemxYyanunx toVru: \eng{river rolls} nadi alealeyAgi hariyutatxde.

\num{7} uruLu; gAligaLa meVloV eMbaMte sAgu, muMduvari: \eng{the years rolled by} vaSaRgaLu uruLiduvu. 
\num{8} (vayxkitx) vAhanadalilx muMde sAgisalapxDu, muMde hoVgu: \eng{he rolled past in his carriage} namamxnunx hAdu avanu tananx vAhanadalilx muMde hoVdanu.

\num{10} uMDeyAgu; beLeyutatx hoVgu; rAshigUDu; Eru; hecAcxgu: \eng{the reckoning is rolling up} lekakx beLeyutAtx, hoVgutitxde, Erutitxde.

\num{12} haraDu; haraDiko: \eng{the paint rolls easily} baNaNx sulaBavAgi haraDikoLuLxtatxde. 
\num{13} (kAru \mo vugaLa \vi) paliTxhoDe; talekeLagAgu. 
\num{14} (kudure \mo vugaLa \vi) beninxna meVle malagi, \kanmu\ savArananunx keDavalu, uruLADu.

\num{17} (yaMtarxda \vi) kelasamADalu yA calisalu pArxraMBisu: \eng{the train began to roll} reYlu calisalu pArxraMBisitu.

\noindent

\num{2} \eng{be rolling in} (\AmA) (\kanmu\ haNa) samaqdidhxyAgiru; heVraLavAgiru.

\num{4} \eng{rolled into one} oMdeV vayxkitx yA vasutxvinalilx seVrisida, seVrida: \eng{saint and philosopher rolled into one} saMtanU dAshaRnikanU obabxnalelxV hurigoMDu, seVrikoMDu, EkiVBavisi.

\num{3} gulAbiya Akqti, mAdari, mATa. 
\num{4} (pAdarakeSxya meVle yA pAdirxya Topipxgeya meVle hAkuva) gulAbiyAkqtiya alaMkAra. 
\num{5} (pArxNiya) koMbina buDadalilx yA (kelavu hakikxgaLa) kaNiNxna sutatx iruva ububx, gubaTu. 
\num{6} (sasayxgaLige niVru hoyuyxva) keYtoTiTxya yA niVkoRLaviya seVcaka, sUsubAyi; siMparaNe mADuva sUsubAyi. 
\num{7} tiLi kaDugeMpu(baNaNx); pATala vaNaR; gulAbi baNaNx. 
\num{8} (\sA\ \bava dalilx) keMpu muKavaNaR; gulAbiraMgu: \eng{has quite lost her roses} avaLa muKada gulAbiraMganunx pUtiRyAgi kaLedukoMDidAdxLe. 
\num{9} siVliMgf roVsf; cAvaNi gulAbi; viduyxtatxMtiyanunx tUrisiruva, sUrinalilx hAkuva, vqtAtxkArada, pAlxsiTxkikxna sAdhana.

\num{11} = \hyperlink{rose-window}{rose-window}. 
\num{12} (\bava dalilx) anukUlakara parisithxtigaLu, yashasusx (\mo vanunx sUcisuva padagucaCxgaLalilx \parx): \eng{roses all the way} saMpUNaR yashasusx; udadxkUkx anukUla. 
\num{13} sogasAda, suMdaravAda--vayxkitx yA vasutx, \kanmu\ suMdara heMgasu: \eng{English rose} iMgilxSf suMdari. \eng{not the rose but near} atayxMta suMdariyalalx, Adare adara hatitxra idAdxLe. 
\num{14} (\rUpa) suKasithxti; nemamxdiya sithxti; hitavAda sithxti: \eng{life is not all roses} jiVvanapUtiR suKasithxtiyalalx.

\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\bmng
\hyperdef{R}{rose pagu}{} 
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{attar of roses} gulAbi atatxru. 
\num{2} \eng{bed of roses} gulAbi hAsige; suKashayeyx; suKavAda matutx sulaBavAda kelasa, sAthxna yA sithxti: \eng{is no bed of roses} gulAbi hAsigeyalalx. 
\num{3} \eng{crumpled rose leaf} (suKavanunx, AnaMdavanunx, nemamxdiyanunx keDisuvaMtha) saNaNx kirukuLa yA kelxVsha. 
\num{4} \eng{gather roses} BoVga bayasu; BoVgavanunx huDukikoMDu hoVgu; BoVga arasu; suKa apeVkiSxsu.

\emng

\noindent
\gl{\sakirx}
\expl{}
\bmng
% 
\bnum
\num{1} (keYyanunx yA inonxMdu vasutxvanunx) ujujx; tikukx; tiVDu; teVyi. 
\num{2} ujijx cokakxTamADu; tikikx beLagu. 
\num{3} ujijxhAku; hereduhAku; teVduhAku. 
\num{4} ujijx p arxtimADu; loVhada yA kalilxna Palakadalilx ketitxda akaSxra, citarx \mo vugaLa meVle kAgada iTuTx baNaNxda siVmeya suNaNx \mo vanunx ujijx parxtiyetutx. 
\num{5} (keYyanunx, vasutxvanunx oMdara meVle) tiVDu. 
\num{6} (vasutxgaLanunx parasapxra) hose; mase; ujujx. 
\num{7} (kare \mo vanunx) ujijxhAku; tikikx aLisu. 
\num{8} (vasatxrXda guMju \mo vanunx, rUpakavAgi nAcike, hosatana \mo vanunx) toDeduhAku. 
\num{9} (teYla \mo vanunx) oLakekx -- otutx, ujujx, leVpisu. 
\num{10} ujijx puDimADu. 
\num{11} (oMdariyalilx) tikikx udurisu. 
\num{12} (hecicxna gAtarxvanunx, hecicxna maTaTxvanunx) teVduhAku; ujijx kaDamemADu. 
\num{13} (mulAmanunx) hacucx; baLi; leVpisu. 
\num{14} (kudureyanunx) mAliVsumADu. 
\num{15} (tananxnunx) aMdamADiko; niVTu mADiko. 
\num{16} (mAsida vasutxvige) ujijx kAMti koDu; tikikx hoLapu koDu. 
\num{17} (\rUpa) (jAcnxpaka shakitx, Odidadx videyx \mo vanunx) curukugoLisiko; ecacxramADiko; kudurisiko; nenapige taMduko. 
\num{18} (cAkaleVTu, baNaNx \mo vanunx) teVyi; are (\rUpa\ saha). 
\num{19} ujijx ujijx -- huNuNx mADu, gAya mADu, camaR eDe. 
\num{20} (matotxMdakekx) ujujxtitxru; tikukxtitxru. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\akirx}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} (boVlfsx ceMDina \vi) nelada ErupeVriniMda -- calane taDeyAgu, vakarxvAgi hoVgu. 
\numi{2} (\rUpa) 
\banum
\alnum{a} (vayxkitx, kAyaRvidhAna \mo vugaLa \vi) kaSaTxpaTuTxkoMDu muMde sAgu; sharxmadiMda muMduvari. 
\alnum{b} jiVvana sAgisu: \eng{many men could rub along happily without works of art} aneVkaru kalAkqtigaLilalxde saMtoVSavAgi jiVvana sAgisikoMDu hoVgabalalxru. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{3} (baTeTx, camaR \mo vu) ujijxhoVgu; saveduhoVgu; tAgi, baDidu -- taredu hoVgu, teVduhoVgu. 
\num{4} (oMdakekx) ujijx calisu. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{rub along} (\engit{or} \eng{on)} (\AmA) heVLikoLuLxvaMtha kaSaTxvilalxde heVgoV niBAyisu, nivaRhisu. 
\num{2} \eng{rub bare} savesu. 
\num{3} \eng{rub down} ujijx oNagisu, nayamADu yA shudidhxmADu. 
\num{4} \eng{rub dry} ujijx -- Arisu, oNagisu. 
\num{5} \eng{rub it in} (\rUpa) (pATha, apamAna saMgati, apirxya viSaya \mo vanunx) otitx otitx heVLu; aredu huyiyx; manasisxge nATuvaMte oLakekx tiVDu. 
\num{6} \eng{rub noses} (kelavu kADujanaralilx) parasapxra edurugoLuLx; vaMdisu; (vaMdisuva sUcaneyAgi) mUgu mUgu ujujx. 
\numi{7} \eng{rub off} 
\banum
\alnum{a} saMpakaRdiMda vagARyisalapxDu: \eng{some of his attitudes have rubbed off on me} avana kelavu dhoVraNegaLu avana sahavAsadiMda nanage vagARyisalapxTiTxve, baMdive. 
\alnum{b} ujijx tegedu hAku. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{8} \eng{rub one's hands} (\sA\ tuMba tqpitxyanunx sUcisalu) keYujijxko. 
\numi{9} \eng{rub out} 
\banum
\alnum{a} rababxrfniMda aLisu, ujijx hAku. 
\alnum{b} (\kanmu\ \ame) (\ashi) kolulx; sAyisu; mugisibiDu. 
\hyperdef{R}{rub(1) pagu(10)}{} 
\eanum
\numie

\numi{11} \eng{rub up} 
\banum

\alnum{b} Odidadxnunx punaraBAyxsa mADu, nenapige taMduko.

\bentry
\word[run(1)]{run}
\pron{ranf}
\gl{\kirx}
\expl{(\vakaq\ \eng{running}; \BU\ \eng{ran} \ucAcx\ rAYxnf; \BUkaq\ adeV).}
\bmng
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\sakirx}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} (nidiRSaTx darxvadiMda) tuMbi hari: \eng{rivers are said to run blood after an engagement} yudadhxvoMdara taruvAya nadigaLu rakatxdiMda hariyutatxve eMdu heVLalAgide. 
\num{2} (niVru \mo vanunx) harisu; hariyuvaMte mADu; surisu; sUsu; sarxvisu (\rUpa\ saha): \eng{fountains run wine} kAraMjigaLu madayxvanunx ukikxharisutatxve. 
\num{3} (sAnxnada toTiTxge) niVru tuMbu. 
\num{4} mAgaR hiDi: \eng{run a scent} beVTeyalilx vAsane hiDidu hoVgu. 
\num{5} anusarisu: \eng{things must run their course} GaTanegaLu tamamx hAdiyanunx, saMdaBaRgaLu tamamx mAgaRvanunx anusarisaleVbeVku. 
\num{6} (oMdaroLakekx) hogisu; tUrisu; nATisu. 
\num{7} (kirxkeTf) (bAyxTugArana \vi) ranf gaLisalu oMdu vikeTiTxniMda inonxMdakekx ODu. 
\num{8} (paMdayxvanunx, dUravanunx) ODu: \eng{run a race} OTada paMdayxdalilx ODu. 
\num{9} ale; sututx: \eng{run the streets} biVdigaLalilx ale; biVdipoVranAgu; bikAriyAgi ale. 
\num{10} IDAgu; oLagAgu: \eng{run risks} apAyagaLige IDAgu. 
\num{11} naDasu; nivaRhisu: \eng{the Derby was run in a snow-storm} DAbiR kudure jUju himapAtadalilx naDeyitu. 
\num{12} (baTeTxge) dATu holige hAku. 
\num{13} benanxTuTx; beVTeyADu: \eng{run the fox five miles} nariyanunx aidu meYli dUra aTiTxsikoMDu hoVgu. 
\num{14} (yaMtarx, vAhana \mo vanunx) ODisu; naDesu; cAlanegoLisu; ODuvaMte mADu. 
\num{15} (dana \mo vanunx) meVyalu biDu, ATuTx, hoDe: \eng{run cattle} danakarugaLanunx meVyuvudakekx hoDe. 
\num{16} (haNa salilxsuva muMce lekakxvanunx) Eralu biDu; inUnx hecAcxgalu, inUnx beLeyalu -- biDu. 
\num{17} (leVKana \mo vanunx) vqtatxpatirxke yA niyatakAlikadalilx parxkaTisu. 
\num{18} (vayxkitxyanunx) cunAvaNege nililxsu, sUcisu yA beMbalisu. 
\num{19} (vAyxpAra, udayxma \mo vanunx) nivaRhisu; naDesu; nideRVshisu. 
\num{20} (vAhanavanunx) savxMtavAgi iTuTxkoMDu niyatavAgi baLasu, ODisu. 
\num{21} oMdu nidiRSaTx riVtiyalilx ODisu, naDesu, calisuvaMte mADu: \eng{ran the car into a tree} kAranunx marakekx Dikikx hoDesida. 
\num{22} (kaNaNxnunx) sUthxlavAgi -- ODisu, ADisu: \eng{ran my eye down the page} puTada meVle sUthxlavAgi kaNANxDiside. 
\num{23} paMdayxkekx (kudure \mo vanunx) iLisu, BAgiyAgisu, sapxdhiRyanAnxgisu. 
\num{24} (baMdUku \mo vanunx) kaLaLxsAgaNe mADu; kAnUnubAhiravAgi, kaLaLxtanadalilx (deVsha \mo vugaLa oLakekx) nugigxsu. 
\num{25} vAhanadalilx (vayxkitxyanunx) karedukoMDu hoVgu: \eng{run a person to the shop} vayxkitxyanunx aMgaDige vAhanadalilx kUrisikoMDu, karedukoMDu hoVgu. 
\num{26} (vahisida kelasa) mADu; mADi mugisu; nivaRhisu. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\akirx}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} ODu; dhAvisu. 
\numi{2} 
\banum
\alnum{a} OTa kiVLu; ODihoVgu; palAyana mADu. 
\alnum{b} tale tapipxsikoMDu, talemaresikoMDu -- hoVgu, ODu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{3} avasaravasaravAgi hoVgu, parxyANa mADu. 
\numi{4} 
\banum
\alnum{a} gAligaLa meVle hoVgu, uruLu, calisu; akaSxda meVle (heVgoV hAge) sututx; uruLikoMDu, jArikoMDu -- sAgu: \eng{time runs} kAla uruLutitxde. \eng{rope runs in pulley} hagagx kapipxya sutatx tirugutatxde. 
\alnum{b} sarAgavAgi naDe, sAgu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{5} cAlitxyalilxru; jAriyalilxru; kAyARvadhi hoMdiru: \eng{contract runs for two years} karAru eraDu vaSaR jAriyalilxrutatxde. 
\num{6} cAlaneyalilxru: \eng{left the engine running} eMjinanxnunx cAlaneyalilxTaTxnu. 
\num{7} (basusx, reYlu \mo\ sAvaRjanika vAhanagaLa \vi) (BUmiya meVlAgali niVrina meVlAgali tananx mAgaRdalilx sathxLadiMda sathxLakekx) ODADu: \eng{the train is running late} reYlu taDavAgi ODutitxde. 
\num{8} (nATaka, calanacitarx, vasutxparxdashaRna \mo vu) naDeyutitxru; parxdashiRtavAgu: \eng{is now running at the Majestic} mejesiTxkf citarxmaMdiradalilx Iga naDeyutitxde. \eng{the play ran 100 nights} nATaka nUru rAtirx parxdashiRtavAyitu, naDeyitu. 
\numi{9} 
\banum
\alnum{a} paMdayxdalilx sapxdhiRsu. 
\alnum{b} paMdayxdalilx nidiRSaTxsAthxna paDe: \eng{run second} (paMdayxdalilx) eraDaneyavanAgi baru. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{10} (cunAvaNeyalilx shAsanasaBe, adhayxkaSxsAthxna \mo vakekx) umeVduvAranAgi, aBayxthiRyAgi -- nilulx, sapxdhiRsu: \eng{ran for president} adhayxkaSxsAthxnakekx niMtidadx. 
\num{11} (darxva, kALu, maraLu, pAterx \mo vugaLa \vi) hari; suri; soVru; sUsu; toTiTxkukx; sarxvisu (\rUpa\ saha): \eng{till the blood ran} rakatx hariyuva tanaka. 
\num{12} (baTeTxya baNaNxda \vi) (baNaNx hAkiruva BAgadiMda baNaNxhAkada BAgakekx) haraDu; vAyxpisu. 
\num{13} (kirxkeTf) (bAYxTfsxmananxna \vi) ceMDanunx hoDedu (gurikoVlugaLa naDuve) ODu; ODalu pArxraMBisu.
